trans-unit.source: What is Machine Learning on Azure?
trans-unit.target: What is Machine Learning on Azure?

trans-unit.source: | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Explains basic concepts of the fully-managed Machine Learning service, a cloud technology you can use to create, operationalize, and monetize solutions.
trans-unit.target: Explains basic concepts of the fully-managed Machine Learning service, a cloud technology you can use to create, operationalize, and monetize solutions.

trans-unit.source: Introduction to machine learning on Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Introduction to machine learning on Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: What is machine learning?
trans-unit.target: What is machine learning?

trans-unit.source: Machine learning uses computers to run predictive models that learn from existing data in order to forecast future behaviors, outcomes, and trends.
trans-unit.target: Machine learning uses computers to run predictive models that learn from existing data in order to forecast future behaviors, outcomes, and trends.

trans-unit.source: These forecasts or predictions from machine learning can make apps and devices smarter.
trans-unit.target: These forecasts or predictions from machine learning can make apps and devices smarter.

trans-unit.source: When you shop online, machine learning helps recommend other products you might like based on what you've purchased.
trans-unit.target: When you shop online, machine learning helps recommend other products you might like based on what you've purchased.

trans-unit.source: When your credit card is swiped, machine learning compares the transaction to a database of transactions and helps the bank do fraud detection.
trans-unit.target: When your credit card is swiped, machine learning compares the transaction to a database of transactions and helps the bank do fraud detection.

trans-unit.source: What is Machine Learning on Microsoft Azure?
trans-unit.target: What is Machine Learning on Microsoft Azure?

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning is a powerful cloud-based predictive analytics service that makes it possible to quickly create and deploy predictive models as analytics solutions.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning is a powerful cloud-based predictive analytics service that makes it possible to quickly create and deploy predictive models as analytics solutions.

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning not only provides tools to model predictive analytics, but also provides a fully-managed service you can use to publish your predictive models as ready-to-consume web services.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning not only provides tools to model predictive analytics, but also provides a fully-managed service you can use to publish your predictive models as ready-to-consume web services.

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning provides tools for creating complete predictive analytics solutions in the cloud: Quickly create, test, operationalize, and manage predictive models.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning provides tools for creating complete predictive analytics solutions in the cloud: Quickly create, test, operationalize, and manage predictive models.

trans-unit.source: You do not need to buy any hardware nor manually manage virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: You do not need to buy any hardware nor manually manage virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: What is predictive analytics?
trans-unit.target: What is predictive analytics?

trans-unit.source: Predictive analytics uses various statistical techniques - in this case, machine learning - to analyze collected or current data for patterns or trends in order to forecast future events.
trans-unit.target: Predictive analytics uses various statistical techniques - in this case, machine learning - to analyze collected or current data for patterns or trends in order to forecast future events.

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning is a particularly powerful way to do predictive analytics: You can work from a ready-to-use library of algorithms, create models on an internet-connected PC without purchasing additional equipment or infrastructure, and deploy your predictive solution quickly.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning is a particularly powerful way to do predictive analytics: You can work from a ready-to-use library of algorithms, create models on an internet-connected PC without purchasing additional equipment or infrastructure, and deploy your predictive solution quickly.

trans-unit.source: You can also find ready-to-use examples and solutions in the [Microsoft Azure Marketplace](https://datamarket.azure.com/browse?query=machine+learning) or [Machine Learning Gallery](http://gallery.azureml.net/).
trans-unit.target: You can also find ready-to-use examples and solutions in the [Microsoft Azure Marketplace](https://datamarket.azure.com/browse?query=machine+learning) or [Machine Learning Gallery](http://gallery.azureml.net/).

trans-unit.source: Build complete machine learning solutions in the cloud
trans-unit.target: Build complete machine learning solutions in the cloud

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning has everything you need to create predictive analytics solutions in the cloud from a large algorithm library, to a studio for building models, to an easy way to deploy your model as a web service.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning has everything you need to create predictive analytics solutions in the cloud from a large algorithm library, to a studio for building models, to an easy way to deploy your model as a web service.

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio: Create predictive models
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio: Create predictive models

trans-unit.source: Create predictive models in [Machine Learning Studio](machine-learning-what-is-ml-studio.md), a browser-based tool, by dragging, dropping, and connecting modules.
trans-unit.target: Create predictive models in [Machine Learning Studio](machine-learning-what-is-ml-studio.md), a browser-based tool, by dragging, dropping, and connecting modules.

trans-unit.source: What is predictive analytics: Example of a predictive analytics experiment in Azure Machine Learning Studio
trans-unit.target: What is predictive analytics: Example of a predictive analytics experiment in Azure Machine Learning Studio

trans-unit.source: Use a large library of [Machine Learning algorithms and modules](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/f5c746fd-dcea-4929-ba50-2a79c4c067d7) in Machine Learning Studio to jump-start your predictive models.
trans-unit.target: Use a large library of [Machine Learning algorithms and modules](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/f5c746fd-dcea-4929-ba50-2a79c4c067d7) in Machine Learning Studio to jump-start your predictive models.

trans-unit.source: Choose from a library of sample experiments, R and Python packages, and best-in-class algorithms from Microsoft businesses like Xbox and Bing.
trans-unit.target: Choose from a library of sample experiments, R and Python packages, and best-in-class algorithms from Microsoft businesses like Xbox and Bing.

trans-unit.source: Extend Studio modules with your own custom [R](machine-learning-r-quickstart.md) and [Python](machine-learning-execute-python-scripts.md) scripts.
trans-unit.target: Extend Studio modules with your own custom [R](machine-learning-r-quickstart.md) and [Python](machine-learning-execute-python-scripts.md) scripts.

trans-unit.source: In [Machine Learning Community Gallery](machine-learning-gallery-how-to-use-contribute-publish.md), you can get started with Azure Machine Learning and learn from others in the community.
trans-unit.target: In [Machine Learning Community Gallery](machine-learning-gallery-how-to-use-contribute-publish.md), you can get started with Azure Machine Learning and learn from others in the community.

trans-unit.source: Try experiments authored by others, ask questions or post comments about experiments, or publish your own experiments.
trans-unit.target: Try experiments authored by others, ask questions or post comments about experiments, or publish your own experiments.

trans-unit.source: You can also share links to experiments via social networks such as LinkedIn and Twitter.
trans-unit.target: You can also share links to experiments via social networks such as LinkedIn and Twitter.

trans-unit.source: Try predictive experiment samples or contribute your own in Azure Machine Learning Gallery
trans-unit.target: Try predictive experiment samples or contribute your own in Azure Machine Learning Gallery

trans-unit.source: Operationalize predictive analytics solutions: Purchase web services or publish your own
trans-unit.target: Operationalize predictive analytics solutions: Purchase web services or publish your own

trans-unit.source: Purchase ready-to-consume web services from [Microsoft Azure Marketplace](https://datamarket.azure.com/browse?query=machine+learning), such as Recommendations, Text Analytics, and Anomaly Detection.
trans-unit.target: Purchase ready-to-consume web services from [Microsoft Azure Marketplace](https://datamarket.azure.com/browse?query=machine+learning), such as Recommendations, Text Analytics, and Anomaly Detection.

trans-unit.source: Operationalize your predictive analytics models:
trans-unit.target: Operationalize your predictive analytics models:

trans-unit.source: Publish web services
trans-unit.target: Publish web services

trans-unit.source: Train and retrain models through APIs
trans-unit.target: Train and retrain models through APIs

trans-unit.source: Manage web service endpoints
trans-unit.target: Manage web service endpoints

trans-unit.target: Scale web services

trans-unit.source: Consume web services
trans-unit.target: Consume web services

trans-unit.source: Key machine learning terminology and concepts
trans-unit.target: Key machine learning terminology and concepts

trans-unit.source: Data exploration, descriptive analytics, and predictive analytics
trans-unit.target: Data exploration, descriptive analytics, and predictive analytics

trans-unit.source: **Data exploration** is the process of gathering information about a large and often unstructured data set in order find characteristics for focused analysis.
trans-unit.target: **Data exploration** is the process of gathering information about a large and often unstructured data set in order find characteristics for focused analysis.

trans-unit.source: **Data mining** refers to automated data exploration.
trans-unit.target: **Data mining** refers to automated data exploration.

trans-unit.source: **Descriptive analytics** is the process of analyzing a data set in order to summarize what happened.
trans-unit.target: **Descriptive analytics** is the process of analyzing a data set in order to summarize what happened.

trans-unit.source: The vast majority of business analytics - such as sales reports, web metrics, and social networks analysis - are descriptive.
trans-unit.target: The vast majority of business analytics - such as sales reports, web metrics, and social networks analysis - are descriptive.

trans-unit.source: **Predictive analytics** is the process of building models from historical or current data in order to forecast future outcomes.
trans-unit.target: **Predictive analytics** is the process of building models from historical or current data in order to forecast future outcomes.

trans-unit.source: Supervised and unsupervised learning
trans-unit.target: Supervised and unsupervised learning

trans-unit.source: **Supervised learning** algorithms are trained with labeled data - in other words, data comprised of examples of the answers wanted.
trans-unit.target: **Supervised learning** algorithms are trained with labeled data - in other words, data comprised of examples of the answers wanted.

trans-unit.source: For instance, a model that identifies fraudulent credit card use would be trained from a data set in which data points indicating known fraudulent and valid charges were labeled.
trans-unit.target: For instance, a model that identifies fraudulent credit card use would be trained from a data set in which data points indicating known fraudulent and valid charges were labeled.

trans-unit.source: Most machine learning is supervised.
trans-unit.target: Most machine learning is supervised.

trans-unit.source: **Unsupervised learning** is used on data with no labels, and the goal is to find relationships in the data.
trans-unit.target: **Unsupervised learning** is used on data with no labels, and the goal is to find relationships in the data.

trans-unit.source: For instance, you might want to find groupings of customer demographics with similar buying habits.
trans-unit.target: For instance, you might want to find groupings of customer demographics with similar buying habits.

trans-unit.source: Model training and evaluation
trans-unit.target: Model training and evaluation

trans-unit.source: A machine learning model is an abstraction of the question you are trying to answer or the outcome you want to predict.
trans-unit.target: A machine learning model is an abstraction of the question you are trying to answer or the outcome you want to predict.

trans-unit.source: Models are trained and evaluated from existing data.
trans-unit.target: Models are trained and evaluated from existing data.

trans-unit.source: Training from data
trans-unit.target: Training from data

trans-unit.source: In Azure Machine Learning, a model is built from an algorithm module that processes training data and functional modules, such as a scoring module.
trans-unit.target: In Azure Machine Learning, a model is built from an algorithm module that processes training data and functional modules, such as a scoring module.

trans-unit.source: In supervised learning, if you're training a fraud detection model, you'll use a set of transactions that are labeled as either fraudulent or valid.
trans-unit.target: In supervised learning, if you're training a fraud detection model, you'll use a set of transactions that are labeled as either fraudulent or valid.

trans-unit.source: You'll split your data set randomly, and use part to train the model and part to test or evaluate the model.
trans-unit.target: You'll split your data set randomly, and use part to train the model and part to test or evaluate the model.

trans-unit.source: Evaluation data
trans-unit.target: Evaluation data

trans-unit.source: Once you have a trained model, evaluate the model using the remaining test data.
trans-unit.target: Once you have a trained model, evaluate the model using the remaining test data.

trans-unit.source: You use data you already know the outcomes for, so that you can tell whether your model predicts accurately.
trans-unit.target: You use data you already know the outcomes for, so that you can tell whether your model predicts accurately.

trans-unit.source: Other common machine learning terms
trans-unit.target: Other common machine learning terms

trans-unit.source: **algorithm**: A self-contained set of rules used to solve problems through data processing, calculation, or automated reasoning.
trans-unit.target: **algorithm**: A self-contained set of rules used to solve problems through data processing, calculation, or automated reasoning.

trans-unit.source: **categorical data**: Data that is organized by categories and that can be divided into groups.
trans-unit.target: **categorical data**: Data that is organized by categories and that can be divided into groups.

trans-unit.source: For example a categorical data set for autos could specify year, make, model, and price.
trans-unit.target: For example a categorical data set for autos could specify year, make, model, and price.

trans-unit.source: **classification**: A model for organizing data points into categories based on a data set for which category groupings are already known.
trans-unit.target: **classification**: A model for organizing data points into categories based on a data set for which category groupings are already known.

trans-unit.source: **feature engineering**: The process of extracting or selecting features related to a data set in order to enhance the data set and improve outcomes.
trans-unit.target: **feature engineering**: The process of extracting or selecting features related to a data set in order to enhance the data set and improve outcomes.

trans-unit.source: For instance, airfare data could be enhanced by days of the week and holidays.
trans-unit.target: For instance, airfare data could be enhanced by days of the week and holidays.

trans-unit.source: See [Feature selection and engineering in Azure Machine Learning](machine-learning-feature-selection-and-engineering.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Feature selection and engineering in Azure Machine Learning](machine-learning-feature-selection-and-engineering.md).

trans-unit.source: **module**: A functional element in a Machine Learning Studio model, such as the Enter Data module which enables entering and editing small data sets.
trans-unit.target: **module**: A functional element in a Machine Learning Studio model, such as the Enter Data module which enables entering and editing small data sets.

trans-unit.source: An algorithm is also a type of module in Machine Learning Studio.
trans-unit.target: An algorithm is also a type of module in Machine Learning Studio.

trans-unit.source: **model**: For supervised learning, a model is the product of a machine learning experiment comprised of a training data set, an algorithm module, and functional modules, such as a Score Model module.
trans-unit.target: **model**: For supervised learning, a model is the product of a machine learning experiment comprised of a training data set, an algorithm module, and functional modules, such as a Score Model module.

trans-unit.source: **numerical data**: Data that has meaning as measurements (continuous data) or counts (discrete data).
trans-unit.target: **numerical data**: Data that has meaning as measurements (continuous data) or counts (discrete data).

trans-unit.source: Also referred to as *quantitative data*.
trans-unit.target: Also referred to as *quantitative data*.

trans-unit.source: **partition**: The method by which you divide data into samples.
trans-unit.target: **partition**: The method by which you divide data into samples.

trans-unit.source: See [Partition and Sample](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905960.aspx) for more information.
trans-unit.target: See [Partition and Sample](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905960.aspx) for more information.

trans-unit.source: **prediction**: A prediction is a forecast of a value or values from a machine learning model.
trans-unit.target: **prediction**: A prediction is a forecast of a value or values from a machine learning model.

trans-unit.source: You might also see the term "predicted score"; however, predicted scores are not the final output of a model.
trans-unit.target: You might also see the term "predicted score"; however, predicted scores are not the final output of a model.

trans-unit.source: An evaluation of the model follows the score.
trans-unit.target: An evaluation of the model follows the score.

trans-unit.source: **regression**: A model for predicting a continuous value based on independent variables, such as predicting the price of a car based on its year and make.
trans-unit.target: **regression**: A model for predicting a continuous value based on independent variables, such as predicting the price of a car based on its year and make.

trans-unit.source: **score**: A predicted value generated from a trained classification or regression model, using the [Score Model module](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905995.aspx) in Machine Learning Studio.
trans-unit.target: **score**: A predicted value generated from a trained classification or regression model, using the [Score Model module](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905995.aspx) in Machine Learning Studio.

trans-unit.source: Classification models also return a score for the probability of the predicted value.
trans-unit.target: Classification models also return a score for the probability of the predicted value.

trans-unit.source: Once you've generated scores from a model, you can evaluate the model's accuracy using the [Evaluate Model module](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905915.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Once you've generated scores from a model, you can evaluate the model's accuracy using the [Evaluate Model module](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn905915.aspx).

trans-unit.source: **sample**: A part of a data set intended to be representative of the whole.
trans-unit.target: **sample**: A part of a data set intended to be representative of the whole.

trans-unit.source: Samples can be selected randomly or based on specific features of the data set.
trans-unit.target: Samples can be selected randomly or based on specific features of the data set.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: You can learn the basics of predictive analytics and machine learning using a [step-by-step tutorial](machine-learning-create-experiment.md) and by [building on samples](machine-learning-sample-experiments.md).
trans-unit.target: You can learn the basics of predictive analytics and machine learning using a [step-by-step tutorial](machine-learning-create-experiment.md) and by [building on samples](machine-learning-sample-experiments.md).
